title: Quadrilateral
summary:
A quadrilateral is a polygon in Euclidean plane geometry with four edges (sides) and four vertices (corners). Other names for quadrilateral include quadrangle (in analogy to triangle) and tetragon (in analogy to, e.g., pentagon or hexagon). A quadrilateral with vertices

,

    {\displaystyle B}
  
,

    {\displaystyle C}
  
 and 
  
    
      
        D
      
    
    {\displaystyle D}
  
 is sometimes denoted as

        A
        B
        C
        D
      
    
    {\displaystyle \square ABCD}
  
.[1]
